content.description: The crack/flake system on the left side of the boulder. Kind of dirty, but big holds
content.location: On the left side of the boulder, if you're facing it from the trail

content.description: Slabby. Start with one hand on the left facing sidepull in the crack and one hand higher up on whatever little microscopic crimp you desire. Put your right foot on this tiny little nub and pull up until you can get your left foot in the crack. Then trust your feet and make careful moves up the slab on next-to-nothing holds. A decent route, trust your feet!
content.protection: pad, although the landing isn't awful
content.location: The slab on the side of the boulder facing the trail, look for the shallow crack.

content.description: This boulder is on the side of Williamson, one of the ski trails at Mount Sunapee. It's not the most amazing boulder in the world, but it has a few decent problems that make it worth throwing you climbing shoes in the bag if you're going for a hike. Most of the boulder is very dirty and covered with lichen, and I bet if it were to be cleaned properly there could be the potential for some more problems on this thing.
